item.title: Tuples in Typescript
item.description: Tuples is a type that exists in Typescript which is similar to Array type but has fixed length and defined what kind of element (either same or different types) will be there at a certain position. // Array example const a: number[] = [1,2,3]; // Tuple example const t: [string, number, boolean] = ['2', 1, true]; Since Tuples are just arrays, so it will allow to push a new element only of type either string or number as defined in the tupleType below.
